intro: Colymbada dichroantha, commonly known as the two-colored water lily, is a striking aquatic plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, floating leaves that are typically green on top and silver-white underneath, creating a distinctive two-toned appearance. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are usually pink or white, which bloom above the water surface. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats, often in ponds and lakes. Colymbada dichroantha plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
